title: Friendly Numbers
description:
For an integer x, we call another integer y "friendly" if the following condition holds: y - d(y) = x, where d(y) is the sum of the digits of y.

For a given integer x, determine how many friendly numbers it has.
input_format:
The first line contains the number of test cases t (1 ≤ t ≤ 500).

Each test case consists of a single line containing one integer x (1 ≤ x ≤ 10^9).
output_format: For each test case, output one integer — the number of friendly numbers for x.
constraints:
Examples:
- The number 1 does not have any friendly numbers.
- The number 18 has 10 friendly numbers: 20, 21, 22, ..., 29. For example, 20 - d(20) = 20 - 2 = 18.
- The number 998244360 has 10 friendly numbers: 998244400 through 998244409.
